facts: Plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide in a process called photosynthesis.
Most of the oxygen in Earth’s air is produced by photosynthetic organisms, including plants and tiny ocean algae.
A plant’s roots absorb water and minerals from the soil and also help anchor the plant in place.
Some plants, like the Venus flytrap, can trap insects to get extra nutrients in nutrient-poor soils.
Bamboo is one of the fastest-growing plants and some species can grow more than 30 centimeters in a single day.
Seeds can stay dormant for a long time and still grow later when conditions become right.
Plants can communicate using chemicals, warning nearby plants about pests so they can boost their defenses.
